page.title: 08LIFESTYLE,1940'S,MADDERTY
page.content: We were talking to our school cook about when she was a young girl on a farm in{Madderty in the 1940's.}Four men used to work on their farm but only one man works there now. Everyone in the family helped out with the farm chores. They had animals,cows and sheep,just like today, which were fed on hay and turnips as they did not make silage then. Instead of machines for milking cows, they{milked by hand. They used Clydesale horses instead of tractors. The crops grown were mostly {oats and wheat.}During the war{flax {and sugar beet}were grown. To harvest crops{a binder}was used instead of a combine. The wheat was put into stooks and built into haystacks to dry. A {threshing mill}was used for separating grain. She liked the life better then.
